**Silence** is a level 5 [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes")/[Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic") spell which creates the Silence effect.

## Contents

- [1 Effect](#Effect)
  - [1.1 Radius](#Radius)
- [2 Sources](#Sources)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Monster Version](#Monster_Version)
- [5 History](#History)
- [6 References](#References)

## Effect

Silence itself creates an aura around the user, which mutes all [noise](/Noise "Noise") and prevents creatures from doing the following actions:

- Reading scrolls
- Casting spells (all spells for the player)
- Using [divine](/God "God") abilities
- [Shouting](/T "T")

Monster spells have a unique restriction. Spells or abilities that require spoken words - those with the *Wizardly*, *Vocal*, or *Priest* [spell slot flags](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") - are stopped by Silence. For example, most [demons](/Demon "Demon") are immune to silence - they use the *Magical* spell flag, meaning they cast from innate magical power rather than reciting from a [spellbook](/Spellbook "Spellbook"). Even player spells like [Fire Storm](/Fire_Storm "Fire Storm") can be cast if they are set with the Magical flag.

The silence aura also inflicts a -50 [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") penalty while players are emitting it.

For the Silence spell, the duration and radius of this aura depends on [spellpower](/Spellpower "Spellpower"), but is slightly randomized. Using a [scroll of silence](/Scroll_of_silence "Scroll of silence") creates a similar effect at a power of 30 - on average, creating a radius 4-5 aura.

### Radius

The radius starts shrinking with 43 turns to go, and during the last 6 turns only the center tile (you) is silenced. Pre-squared radius is reduced linearly from 37 = 6\*6+1, which means that radius is reduced like `sqrt(duration)` - slowly at large radius, and faster near the end.

The Silence spell creates an aura with a duration of `19 + power/5 + 1d(power/2)` turns (capped at 100 turns)[\[1\]](#cite_note-1).

That's at least 10 turns, at most 100. At 50 power (mid-game caster) you'll get an average of 34, which means you'll usually start below maximal radius.

## Sources

- The spell and [scroll](/Scroll_of_silence "Scroll of silence")
- Possible effect from [Throw Klown Pie](/Throw_Klown_Pie "Throw Klown Pie"), with a radius of 2.
- Innate aura from [silent spectres](/Silent_spectre "Silent spectre").
- The [demonspawn mutation](/Demonspawn_mutation "Demonspawn mutation"), [Black Mark](/Black_Mark_\(mutation\) "Black Mark (mutation)") 3 (permanent radius 1, excluding your own tile)

## Strategy

Silence stops certain types of enemies cold. So long as you can deal damage without casting spells, you can reduce many [uniques](/Unique "Unique") and devastating spellcasters into pitiful melee opponents. Just be sure to defeat them before Silence wears out; the period where silence only affects you is especially deadly. [Scrolls of silence](/Scrolls_of_silence "Scrolls of silence") replicate the effect of the silence spell, though the scrolls are rare and have a short duration.

Make sure to use **[x](/X "X")** then **[v](/V "V")** (or right click in Tiles mode) to confirm that a given enemy is affected by silence. Examples of enemies that silence *does* work on include all sorts of [deep elves](/List_of_deep_elves "List of deep elves"), [liches](/Lich "Lich"), and [mummy priests](/Mummy_priest "Mummy priest"). Examples of enemies that silence *does not* work on include [dragons](/Dragon "Dragon"), [eyeballs](/Eyeball "Eyeball"), and all types of [demons](/Demon "Demon") (such as [Azrael](/Azrael "Azrael"), [Mara](/Mara "Mara"), and all [pandemonium lords](/Pandemonium_lord "Pandemonium lord")).

A [potion of cancellation](/Potion_of_cancellation "Potion of cancellation") can end your own silence aura early. While it also dispels any buffs you had, ending silence can be worth it in order to use escape tools, such as god abilities and [scrolls of blinking](/Scrolls_of_blinking "Scrolls of blinking").

On the other hand, monster silence can be incredibly threatening, even for melee characters, as losing escape tools is very dangerous. To escape silence, a player would need to walk away. As the most common silencing monsters (Mennas, Ereshkigal, many silencing pan lords) are fast, this is a near-impossible task. A [wand of quicksilver](/Wand_of_quicksilver "Wand of quicksilver") can end monster silence, but it is inaccurate.

## Monster Version

The following enemies cast Silence:

- & [![Ereshkigal.png](/images/a/a8/Ereshkigal.png)](/File:Ereshkigal.png) **[Ereshkigal](/Ereshkigal "Ereshkigal")**
- A [![Mennas.png](/images/b/b6/Mennas.png)](/File:Mennas.png) **[Mennas](/Mennas "Mennas")**

The following enemies may be able to cast Silence, depending on their spell set:

- & [![Pandemonium lord.png](/images/c/c6/Pandemonium_lord.png)](/File:Pandemonium_lord.png) **[Pandemonium lord](/Pandemonium_lord "Pandemonium lord")** (7.5% chance)

The following enemy inherently radiates Silence:

- W [![Silent spectre.png](/images/b/b1/Silent_spectre.png)](/File:Silent_spectre.png) **[Silent spectre](/Silent_spectre "Silent spectre")** (as a permanent 12-tile [aura](/Aura "Aura"), whether awake or [dormant](/Dormant "Dormant"))

You can end the monster spell (but not the silent spectre aura) with a [wand of quicksilver](/Wand_of_quicksilver "Wand of quicksilver"). If it [hasn't generated](/Alternate_items "Alternate items"), you'll need to let the spell run its course, kill the monster, or otherwise move away.

In the case of silent spectres, their silence aura has an effect larger than your [LOS](/LOS "LOS"), so you will have to resort to non-silenceable means of fighting them.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), silence lasted for `9 + power/4 + 1d(power/2)`, which resulted in lower duration at low spell power.
- Prior to [0.9](/0.9 "0.9"), Silence was a [Charms](/Charms "Charms")/[Air magic](/Air_magic "Air magic") spell.
- Before the magic school was removed from the game in [0.8](/0.8 "0.8"), Silence was an [Enchantments](/Enchantments "Enchantments")/[Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic") spell. Also, the spell was less reliable, because its duration had a high variance.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [spl-selfench.cc:208](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/spl-selfench.cc#L208) (0.30.0)

Eliminates all sound near the caster. This makes reading scrolls, casting spells, invoking divine abilities, or shouting impossible in the caster's vicinity. The spell's oppressive, unnatural effect will greatly hamper stealth.

Certain monsters have innate magical or special abilities which will still be usable while silenced.

The effect starts out with a radius depending on power, which will then shrink, eventually covering only the caster, before it times out.

The following enemies cast Silence:

  • & Ereshkigal
  • A Mennas

  • & Pandemonium lord (7.5% chance)

  • W Silent spectre (as a permanent 12-tile aura, whether awake or dormant)
